page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA
page.content: THIS AREA IS SITUATED A FEW MILES SOUTH-EAST OF READING AND THE M4.THE LANDSCAPE IS ONE OF GENTLE SLOPES,THE HIGHEST POINT BEING 84 METRES ASL AND THE LOWEST 44.THE RIVER LODDON FLOWS FROM SW TO NE ACROSS THE AREA TO JOIN THE RIVER THAMES EAST OF READING.OVER 50% OF THE TOTAL AREA CONSISTS OF FARMLAND,WITH A MARKED EMPHASIS ON DAIRY FARMING.THERE IS ALSO A SUBSTANTIAL AMOUNT OF DECIDUOUS WOODLAND,AS IN SWALLOWFIELD PARK,WHILE THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA IS OCCUPIED BY EXPANDED VILLAGES SUCH AS THE EASTERN FRINGE OF SPENCERS WOOD,THE SOUTHERN EDGE OF SHINFIELD AND THE VILLAGE OF ARBORFIELD.THE MAJORITY OF WORKING PEOPLE LIVING IN THE AREA EITHER COMMUTE INTO READING TO WORK OR TRAVEL ALONG THE M4 TO BRACKNELL OR EVEN FURTHER EAST TOWARDS SLOUGH AND LONDON.
